rent.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to regularly pay money to live in a house or room that belongs to someone else, or to use something that belongs to someone else
rent.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Most students rent rooms in their second year.
I’d rather have my own house than rent.
Some farmers rent their land from the council.
rent.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to let someone live in a house, room etc that you own, or use your land, in return for money
rent.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: She rents out two rooms to students.
rent.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to pay money for the use of something for a short period of time
rent.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Will you rent a car while you’re in Spain?
rent.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: to pay money to use something
rent
to pay money to use a house, room, vehicle, piece of equipment, area of land etc
He rented a room in a house on the Old Kent Road.
They flew out to New York and rented a car at the airport.
hire
to pay money to use a car or a piece of clothing or equipment for a short period of time
Why don't we hire a van for the day?
You can hire suits for weddings.
lease
to have a legal agreement under which you pay money to a person or company in order to use a building, area of land, vehicle, piece of equipment etc for a fixed period of time
They leased the offices from an American company.
The car is leased from BMW.
to allow somebody to use something for money
rent/rent something out
to allow someone to use a house, room, vehicle, piece of equipment, area of land etc in return for money
She rents the flat out to students.
let/let something out
to allow someone to use a room, house, building etc in return for money
Some people don't want to let rooms to foreigners.
They let the house out while they were on holiday.
lease/lease something out
to make a legal agreement which allows a person or company to use something that you own for a fixed period of time
Santa Clara ' s Redevelopment Agency leased the existing city golf course to developers.
rent.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: the money that someone pays regularly to use a room, house etc that belongs to someone else
rent.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: I pay the rent at the beginning of every month.
rent.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: an amount of money that you pay to use a car, boat etc that belongs to someone else
rent.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: The rent was only $20 an hour.
rent.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: a large tear in something made of cloth
rent.translation[1].note_box[0].sections: Rents in the city centre are very high.
Our workers get low rents and other advantages.
The rent is fixed for three years.
The government plans to provide more homes at affordable rents.
Our annual rent is just over $15000.
There is an additional ground rent of £30 per month.
The colonel let us have the cottage for a peppercorn rent.
Mrs Carr said she is still owed several thousand dollars in back rent.
The rent is due at the beginning of the week.
She couldn’t afford to pay the rent.
The landlord wants to put up the rent.
fall behind with the rent/get behind on the rent
You could be evicted if you fall behind with the rent.
His job is to collect the rents from the tenants.
The rent has gone up by over 50% in the last two years.
How can they justify such big rent increases?
The most common debts were rent arrears.
rent.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: the past tense and past participle of rend
rent.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: to pay a regular amount of money for the use of something such as a house or office
rent.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: The company had been renting for seven years before buying a 13,000-square-foot headquarters.
Businesses can rent PCs to alleviate peak workloads.
Who do you rent the shop from?
rent.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: to allow someone to use something in return for payment
rent.translation[3].definitions[1].examp: video stores that rent Nintendo games
the lucrative business of renting out trailers and trucks
A New York dealer rented an Avis car to an unauthorized driver.
Many people trying to sell their second homes have decided to rent them out to tourists instead.
rent.translation[3].definitions[2].defin: to pay money for the use of something owned by someone else for a short period of time
rent.translation[3].definitions[2].examp: Travelers prefer to rent cars with low mileage.
rent.translation[3].definitions[3].defin: if a house, office etc rents at or rents for a particular amount of money, that is how much it costs to use it
rent.translation[3].definitions[3].examp: The new units are renting for £350 a month or less.
rent.translation[4].definitions[0].defin: money paid for the use of a house, office etc
rent.translation[4].definitions[0].examp: Commercial rents have decreased significantly over the last few years.
rent.translation[4].definitions[1].examp: There is a lack of affordable housing for rent.
